text: The 14th Kedah State election will be held on 9 May 2018. The previous state election was held on 5 May 2013. The state assemblymen is elected to 5 years term each. The Kedah State Legislative Assembly would automatically dissolve on 23 June 2018, the fifth anniversary of the first sitting, and elections must be held within sixty days (two months) of the dissolution (on or before 21 August 2018, with the date to be decided by the Election Commission), unless dissolved prior to that date by the Head of State (Sultan of Kedah) on the advice of the Head of Government (Menteri Besar of Kedah). ==Contenders== Barisan Nasional (BN) is set to contest all 36 seats in Kedah State Legislative Assembly. Barisan Nasional (BN) linchpin party United Malays National Organisation (UNMO) is to set to contest major share of Barisan Nasional (BN) seats. Pan-Malaysian Islamic Party (PAS) is set to contest all 36 seats in Kedah.PAS Kedah tampil 70 peratus calon baru Pakatan Harapan have decided to contest all 36 seats in Kedah. On 4 February 2018, Pakatan Harapan has yet to finalize 4 seats. The seats are Guar Chempedak, Pantai Merdeka, Gurun and Kulim.4 kerusi DUN Kedah masih tak selesai On 26 February 2018, Pakatan Harapan has completed the distribution of seats in Kedah. Malaysian United Indigenous Party (Bersatu) is to set to contest major share of Pakatan Harapan seats.Rundingan muktamad, Bersatu beroleh kerusi DUN terbanyak Malaysian United Indigenous Party (Bersatu) will contest in 14 seats while the National Trust Party (Amanah) will have 10 seats. People's Justice Party (PKR) and the Democratic Action Party (DAP) will contest 10 and 2 seats. === Political parties === {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="3" |Coalition ! rowspan="2" |Other parties |- !Incumbent ! colspan="2" |Opposition |- |Barisan Nasional (BN) |50x50px Pakatan Harapan (PH) |Gagasan Sejahtera (GS) | rowspan="2" | * 50x50px Parti Rakyat Malaysia (PRM) PRM umum tanding satu kerusi Parlimen, tiga Dun di Kedah |- | * 45x45px United Malays National Organisation (UMNO) * 45x45px Malaysian Chinese Association (MCA) * 45x45px Malaysian Indian Congress (MIC) * Parti Gerakan Rakyat Malaysia (Gerakan) | * 50x50px Malaysian United Indigenous Party (Bersatu) * 50x50px National Trust Party (Amanah) * 50x50px People's Justice Party (PKR) * 50x50px Democratic Action Party (DAP) | * 45x45px Pan-Malaysian Islamic Party (PAS) |} ==The contested seats== {| class="wikitable" ! rowspan="3" |No. ! rowspan="3" |State constituency ! rowspan="3" |Incumbent State Assemblyman ! colspan="8" |Political parties |- !colspan="2" | Barisan Nasional Nawawi akan berdepan Mahathir di Langkawi !colspan="2" |50x50px Pakatan Harapan Amanah umum 13 calon tanding di KedahMahathir bertanding di Langkawi, Wan Saiful sah di Pendang !colspan="2" |40x40px Gagasan Sejahtera Senarai calon Pas bertanding di Kedah pada PRU14 !colspan="2" |Other parties/Ind |- |Candidate Name |Party |Candidate Name |Party |Candidate Name |Party |Candidate Name |Party |- |N01 |Ayer Hangat |Mohd Rawi Abdul Hamid (BN) |Mohd Rawi Abdul Hamid |rowspan="10" |UMNO |Johari Bulat |rowspan="2" |Bersatu |Azlina Azinan |rowspan="37" |PAS | | |- |N02 |Kuah |Nor Saidi Nanyan (BN) |Nor Saidi Nanyan |Mohd Firdaus Ahmad |Mazlan Ahmad |Mohamad Ratu Mansor |IND |- |N03 |Kota Siputeh |Abu Hasan Sarif (BN) |Ahmad Azhar Abdullah |Salmee Said |Amanah |Mat Rejab Md Akhir | | |- |N04 |Ayer Hitam |Mukhriz Mahathir (PH) |Abu Hasan Sarif |A. The government side has 1 safe seat and 3 fairly safe seats.
